designPrinciples.name: Soft & Approachable
designPrinciples.description: No sharp edges. Every primary element, from card containers to data bars and buttons, must use generous rounding. This creates a friendly, non-intimidating feel.

designPrinciples.name: Clarity Through Hierarchy
designPrinciples.description: Guide the user's eye with a strong typographic scale. Key data points should be bold and significantly larger than labels or secondary text. White space is a tool for focus.

designPrinciples.name: Focused Color, Not Loud Color
designPrinciples.description: The palette is minimalist and neutral (whites, greys, dark text) to let the data be the hero. Data itself uses a single, vibrant, warm color for primary representation, creating an energetic but clean look.

designPrinciples.name: Data as the Centerpiece
designPrinciples.description: The visualization (the chart) is the focal point. UI elements like buttons or lists are secondary and should be visually lighter (e.g., grey, smaller text) to avoid competing.

page.description: A very light, subtle grey for the main app background, to make the white cards 'pop'.

card.description: Pure white for all card containers.

text.description: Deep black/dark grey for primary values and titles, ensuring high contrast and readability.
text.secondaryDescription: A medium grey for secondary labels and subtitles (e.g., 'Today (14:00)', '10 - 17 Sep 2022').
text.tertiaryDescription: A lighter grey for tertiary information like X-axis labels ('Mo', 'Tu') and button text.

data.positiveDescription: The primary 'watermelon' red/pink. Use this for all positive-driving features in a SHAP plot.
data.negativeDescription: A complementary 'soft blue' for negative-driving features. This color is not in the image but is derived from the 'soft' principle to contrast the positive color.

palette.accentDescription: The light grey fill for the 'Full stats' button.
palette.dividerDescription: Light grey for all horizontal rules and vertical gridlines.

typography.description: Use a modern, clean, geometric or humanist sans-serif font (e.g., Inter, SF Pro, Roboto).

styles.name: label
styles.description: For axis labels (e.g., 'Mo', 'Tu') and button text.

styles.name: unit
styles.description: For units next to a display value (e.g., 'bpm').

layout.spacing: Use a 4px or 8px grid. Generous padding is key.

dataBar.description: The core of the SHAP plot visualization.
dataBar.style: Solid fill. Use data.positive and data.negative colors.

axis.gridlines: Vertical lines should be thin, 'palette.divider', and dashed. Horizontal 'zero' or 'average' lines should be solid.

tag.description: To highlight a specific data point (e.g., 'Avg. 57').

list.divider: Use a thin, 1px solid line with 'palette.divider' color.
